text: The dragonhead prow of an ancient Viking ship cuts throug thick fog of the rough North Atlantic Sea. MUSIC EXPLODES: WAGNER'S "GOTTERDAMMERUNG" (Twilight of t SUPERIMPOSE: THE TENTH CENTURY A.D.

Viking explorer LEIF ERICSON carefully studies his fob co he dangles it above a parchment map. His SAILORS steal ne looks at a large, diabolical-looking IRON BOX in the hold OLAF, a fierce, one-eyed Viking warrior approaches Ericso Dialog is in OLD NORSE, with SUBTITLES)
Leif, let's do the deed before another night falls. The crew's near mutiny. Ericson draws his broadsword with a flourish.
Know this! The first man to turn will taste my steel in his guts.
But we've surely gone far enough.

That accursed box must be thrown off the edge of the world. We will go until we can go no more... Suddenly there is an ear-splitting SCREECH and the entire rocks violently as it runs aground. The LOOKOUT is thrown from his crow's nest... and CRASHES straight through the deck right in front of Ericson. His voice floats up  from the black hole.
...Land ho. Ericson wheels about just as the fog parts off the starbo ERICSON'S P.O.V. A beautiful rustic coastline stretching off as far as the see.
(GASPS)
By Odin's beard...

Olaf finishes digging a hole in the sand. He backs away,  terrified, as burly Vikings, led by Ericson, muscle the I over to the hole and  quickly bury it. Ericson turns to an exotic-looking Euras WITCH.
Be quick, Witch. Let the deed be done. The Witch unravels a scroll and recites:

Oh Loki, ancient one. Thy mischief dwell now in waters, base and bland. And in waves and sand thy magic forever sleep... As the Witch speaks, a strong wind kicks up and a black w clouds appears. The sky explodes in THUNDER and LIGHTNING
look about fearfully.
Back to the ship men, hurry.
Captain, you've discovered a new world. It is your right to name it.
Leave that to the Italians. We're never coming back here. Never. This land is now cursed.
Hot, smoggy and packed. Cityscape of towering skyscrapers in the haze just beyond the crowded beach.
A caffeine-driven D.J's voice booms over the beach-goers'

Yessiree, it's a four-alarm sizzler out there today with highs in the upper nineties and no relief in sight. We have a third stage smog advisory and a metro traffic gridlock alert. Flourocarbons are up, the Dow Jones is down and we're expecting another Spike Lee movie any second. In other words folks, it's just another bee-youtiful day in Edge City. Camera ENDFRAMES on an industrial barge marked "Departmen Sanitation." A crane's cable line disappears underwater.
SCUBA WELDERS repair a cracked, scum spewing pipe. One di something hard with his dredger. He unearths...

Rust and barnacles partially obscure the engraved images gods and demons. THE DIVER wedges his scuba knife under the corroded lock. 'MASK' theme SFX rise as he tries to pry open the lid. Suddenly the PIPELINE BREAKS FREE, crushing the diver and cracking open the box. SOMETHING (seen only in rippling shadow) explodes out of on a cloud of bubbles and shoots toward the surface.
The Mask surfaces in the f.g. as lightening EXPLODES acro distant cityscape.
A banner displays their proud motto: "WE BANK ON TOMORROW
CHARLIE SCHUMACHER (30's) gazes out the window from his c desk as the crack of THUNDER echos through the urban cany
Look at those clouds rollin' in, man. Freaky weather. STANLEY IPKISS, a bright0eyed amiable young account exec by Charlie's desk and drops off a print-out.
Hey Charlie, can you go over these stats? We're supposed to have a complete report before lunch. Charlie takes one looks at the complex print-outs and tos back.
Woah. Sorry Stanley, I just had my weave tightened and my head is killing me. Be a pal and take those over to Hinkleman, will ya? MAGGIE, a cute young blonde now strolls by.
Hi guys. Did you have any luck with those concert tickets Stanley? Stanley perks up at the sight of her.
I sure did. Friday night, just like you wanted.
Oh, Stanley, that's wonderful.
What time should I pick you up?
Gee, I don't know. My best girlfriend just got into town and I know she'd love to go. Can we get an extra ticket for her?
Well... uh, actually it's sold out. I was kinda lucky to get these.

She's only going to be in town a couple of days and I just can't let her sit at home all alone. Are you sure there isn't something we can do? Stanley considers the situation for a moment, then pulls tickets out of his pocket.
You know what? Here. You two go.
Oh Stanley, I couldn't do that.
No really. Go ahead. It's okay. I hate concerts anyway. All that, you know... music floating around. Maggie snatches the tickets from Stanley's hand.
That is so sweet. Sheila's just going to love this.
So maybe you and I can get together over the weekend?
I'm not sure what's going on, but just give me a call. You know I like to be spontaneous.
Oh, sure. Me too.
Stanley Ipkiss, you are the nicest guy. Maggie gives him a quick air-kiss and hurries off to her window.
That's it.
What?
The kiss of death. As soon as they use the "N" word it's all over.
So maybe I am a nice guy. So what?
You are a rug. I am talking astro-turf here. You're letting these women sharpen their cleats on you.
Hey, I'm a gentleman. If they can't appreciate that, it's their problem.
You spend too much time being "nice" to a girl, you'll wind up sittin' around listening to her complain about the son of a bitch she really loves.
Charlie, you are a very sick puppy.

Wake up, Stanley! These are the nineties. We're dealing with an entire generation of dysfunctional love junkies. You can't romance 'em. You gotta confuse 'em. It's the only thing that gets their attention. (PAUSES)
Let me demonstrate. You see that girl over there? Stanley looks over at the coffee service where an attract young WOMAN is pouring herself a cup of coffee.
Hi Lisa.
(forgets his name) Oh, hi...
Charlie.
That's right. Sorry.
Lisa, this may seem a little odd, but my friend over there and I were having this discusion and I thought maybe you could settle it for us.
I'll help out if I can.
(SHEEPISHLY)
Actually, I don't know... this is kind of a personal question.
That's okay. Go ahead.
Alright. Just for the sake of argument, if I wasn't a happily married man... am I the kind of guy you'd go out with?
Oh, um... I don't know. (PAUSES)
Well... yeah. I guess I would.
Lisa, I have terrific news for you.
What?

I'm not married! Is this perfect or what? Listen, there's not a lot of women willing to come right out like that and admit they're attracted to a guy, but... Lisa SLAPS Charlie, turns on her heel, and marches off.
Jeez... make up your mind. Stanley gives Charlie the fish eye as he returns.

Okay. Bad example. Some of these women got so much baggage they need an emotional sky cap. I'll tell you what Stanley, tonight I'm gonna take you on a love safari, deep into the darkest heart of the urban jungle.
And where's that?
The Monkey's Paw. Hottest new club in town. It's a guaranteed skirt alert and no dead beats allowed.
So how are we gonna get in?

Woah, do I detect a little self-image problem there, buddy? You just leave everything to me. This, my friend is going to be the perfect night on the town. Suddenly a resounding peal of THUNDER rings out like the doom. Sheets of rain pour down on the bank's windows.
Pedestrians scramble for cover in the sudden downpour.
A young woman scurries into the bank holding a newspaper head. She's soaking wet and pauses in the foyer to straig herself out. Charlie immediately notices her...

Hold the phone. Killer at three o'clock. Stanley follows his gaze. STANLEY'S P.O.V. CAMERA does a classic CHEESECAKE TILT-UP starting with th woman's million dollar legs as she squeezes some of the w of her  skirt... up past her body, which through her damp summer is undeniable proof that there is a God... up... up... to face as that  newspaper is tossed aside. She's a heart-stopping woman/c with a Cupid's bow mouth and ice blue eyes. In other word trouble.  Big trouble, also known as TINA CARLYLE. Charlie may as well have just seen the Virgin of Guadalup
(hushed reverence) Oh my god... A perfect dime. The dame of dames. The Moby of my dick.
Easy Charlie. You'll sprain your eyes. Tina now enters and walks towards Stanley and Charlie.
Excuse me, where can I open a new account? Charlie flashes his best 100 watt smile.
You've come to the right place, ma'am. Just step right this way and pull up a chair... Charlie tries to steer Tina to his desk, but she's still  preoccupied with her damp clothing.
Oh, I'm sorry. I'm a complete wreck. Will you hold this please? She hands her shoulder bag to Stanley and peels off her w blazer, creating another awe-inspiring visual moment.
Here, let me take that for you. Charlie clutches her jacket with white knuckles.
Thanks. But Tina turns and sits at Stanley's desk; Charlie is stu his near miss, but there's not a thing he can do about it
So, uh, what kind of account did you have in mind?
(smiles sweetly) Well, I'm not sure exactly. I'm just terrible with things like that. That's an interesting tie Mr...?
Ipkiss. Stanley Ipkiss... Tina extends her hand.
Tina Carlyle. Pleased to meet you.
The, uh... pleasure's all mine. Tina notices a box of Kleenex on Stanley's desk.
May I? I'm such a mess.
Oh... of course. Tina takes out a compact and daintily blots the moisture face.
As I was saying about that tie. It's like one of those, what do you call them, ink blot tests.
A Rorschach test. She twists open a tube of lip gloss andbegins to run it a her incredibly lush liips.
That's it. It looks like... um. A young woman riding bareback. You know, like a Lady Godiva or something.
Really? I don't think I can... She slowly runs a finger along Stanley's tie.
Or... if that's not a horse it could be two lovers. A man and a woman. That would be the woman on top, of course.
(MESMERIZED)
...Of course. She licks her lips and blots them on the Kleenex, leaving perfect kiss impression and drops it on Stanley's desk.
What do you see, Mr. Ipkiss? Stanley starts to get uncomfortable under her gaze.
I don't know. ...Bold colors. It's a power tie, y'know? They're supposed to make you feel... powerful.
Does it work?
Sort of. It's just a tie. Now, about that account.

as Tina drops her compact back in her shoulder bag and we flick a red L.E.D. light on. She carefully adjusts the ba aiming a tiny  CAMERA LENS neatly concealed within it. Tina's pointing the bag at the open bank vault that stand short distance from Stanley's desk.
displaying the shot of the vault that Tina is broadcastin
DORIAN TYREL - a slick nouveau-mobster complete with diam stud and Matsuda jacket watches the video broadcast from
sanctum; an eclectic post-modern playroom with an array o electronic toys and minimalist gun racks. Dorian sips nervously on a Yoo-Hoo as he watches the show
That's it sweetheart. A little to the right. His two gunsels, SWEET EDDY and CHUN WOO are busy at the the room playing air-hockey. Serious firepower is visible
shoulder holsters.
Hey, will you guys keep it down back there? Dorian's safe cracking expert, a black hip-hop artist nam DOCTOR FREEZE scribbles notes as he watches the screen wi practiced eye.
That's cool, man. Freeze it right there. Dorian punches a button and the image freezes.
What do you think, Doctor?
Layout's not bad. We got us a sweet little Perkins/Jenning time lock. But them motion detectors are putting the chill on my thrill.
Can you pull it off?
Hey, you're talkin' with the Doctah, man. It's all about time and money.
Yeah, well the meter's runnin' on this one. We got less than a week.
Not cool. What about the coin?
There's plenty. And I'll be happy to invest your share.
What you talkin' about, man?
This isn't about the lousy couple hundred thou' that's sitting in that vault, Freeze. That's chump change.
Yeah? Then I'm chump number one, man.

We gotta expand your horizons Doctor. Take a look. Dorian pulls back a curtain. An amazingly gaudy building on a pier across the river from Dorian's club. A huge sig it's archway  reads: "Opening Soon Valhalla Casino".

The Valhalla Casino. Twenty mil of glass, neon, booze and dice. World class sucker bait. The grand opening is Saturday night and it will drive this two bit club of mine out of existence. But I say if you can't beat 'em, take 'em over.
Yeah? That's Arnie the Swede's place, man and he is one ice cold meatball eatin' motha fucker.
Leave him to me. You pull off this heist and I promise you, it'll be all tits and champagne from here on in.

The Mask lies tangled in a rat's nest of seaweed and garb that's washed up in a culvert under a bridge. A large WHARF RAT now creeps out along the garbage sniffi curiously at its timeworn wooden surface. It takes a tent nibble.
begins to SHIMMER... to vibrate with its own magical inne The rat SQUEAKS and jumps back, disturbing the pile of ga
The Mask is dislodged and floats back out into the river. TILTS UP with the Mask as it follows the current into the heart of the city.
Stanley and Charlie are riding along at breakneck speed i cab.
Hold it up right here, please. A gun port suddenly SLAMS open and the wild-eyed Albanian DRIVER wheels about and cocks a huge .45 from his side of
riddled partition as the cab continues to barrel through
Hold up?! No hold up! I keel you very well! I splatter your guts big time, Mr. Cowboy Man! Stanley dives for cover.
No! No! He only wants you to stop the cab! The driver instantly SLAMS on the brakes, throwing his pa forward mercilessly.
(now totally calm) Hokay. Pardon you very much. Charlie helps Stanley sit back up.
It's alright, Stanley.
(SOFTLY)
I hate this town. I really hate this town.
Why are you getting out here?
I gotta pick up my car.
Fine. Now don't forget. Ten o'clock at the Monkey's Paw. I've already got us lined up with a couple of authentic dimes. Stanley steps out of the cab.
Charlie, please. The last time you said that you showed up with two lesbian mud-wrestlers.
Well, I can't promise we'll get that lucky again... Later! With a SCREAM of tires the cab peels back out into traffi
Stanley enters the grease spattered, cluttered garage and the area for signs of life. We can hear the CLANK-CLANK-C
less than light-fingered automotive work in progress. Stanley DINGS a little service bell sitting on a counter  plastered with naked playmate decoupage and Mrs. Power To calendars.
...Hello? IRV, a lumbering unshaven behemoth of a man with permanen slung refrigerator repairman pants, makes his way past ha rebuilt car  carcasses towards Stanley.

Hang on. Hong on. Don't get your panties in a twist. BURT, a thinner version of Irv with Coke bottle glasses a of greasy hair, pops up from beneath a car, RIPS out of c motor and  wiring and holds it up to Irv.
(examining part) Hey Irv, what the hell is this?
(eyes it carefully) Ohh... I dunno. About seven hundred bucks. They both laugh evilly as Irv slaps Burt on the back. Irv his way over to Stanley, still chuckling to himself.
Now what can I do for you, Bub?
I'm here for the Civic.
Japanese car, right? Kind of a nasty pea soup green?
Well, they call it Emeral Forest, actually... Irv turns back to Burt.
Burt! Pea green Civic! Burt pops back up from beneath the hood.
Green Civic... Green Civic. Oh yeah! Brake drums are still on order and I'm only halfway through rebuilding the trans.
But I just brought it in for an oil change!
Yeah? Well you're lucky we caught those other problems before they caused some serious trouble.
Alright. Alright. When will it be ready? Irv looks over at Burt, who gives him a "Make something u

Come back tomorro... (Burt shakes his head "no".) ...First thing next wee... (Burt shakes again) ...next month? (Burt shakes an enthusiastic "yes".) Yeah, first thing next month. That's if we can get the parts.
What am I going to do in the meantime? I can't afford to keep taking cabs all over town. Irv smiles a rotten-toothed smile.
Oh, hell... we can take care of that! (to Burt archly) Hey Burt, bring around the loaner. (to Stanley) And for you little buddy, only ten bucks a day.

The joint is jumping with musclehead BOUNCERS picking and choosing from the crowd of terminally trendy WANNABE'S ga around the  entrance. A light drizzle is falling. A parade of swanky cars pulls up one by one as CAR HOPS s keep up with the flow; A glistening pearlescent Rolls Royce. A fire engine red Ferrari. A classic two tone Corniche in tan and burgundy. And finally a broken down Citroen in rust bucket red and gray RUMBLES up to the front of the club with a disgruntl Stanley behind  the wheel. A car hop attempts to open the door, but it's rusted shut Stanley throws his shoulder into it and the door finally open with a SCREECH of  metal. Stanley nearly tumbles out into the street. He smiles nervously at a high class couple looking with d at the eyesore-mobile. He pats the hood.
It's a classic. The car hop jumps in and tries to throw the car into gear horrible GRINDING. He finally waves over two other car ho quickly push  it off down the street.
Hey, Stanley. Nice wheels. What is that, a Rolls Canardley?
A what?
You know, a Rolls Canardley. Rolls down one hill canardley roll up the next. (he cracks up)
We are not discussing the car, okay?
Whatever you say, man. Charlie gestures expansively towards the club.

What do you think? Pretty terrific, huh? This place make Sodom and Gomorrah look like Mayberry. Stanley now notices a life-sized poster of Tina Carlyle s by the main entrance that reads "Featuring the Musical St of Miss Tina  Carlyle."
Hey, isn't that...
Right. The wet dream from the bank. (PAUSES)
Hold on... I think I see my future ex-wife. Two rather tacky looking GIRLS beckon Charlie from the cr
Hey Charlie! Charlie!
(WAVES)
We're in luck. It's Barbie and Pebbles.
Doesn't it bother you that all the women you know are named after cartoon characters? Barbie and Pebbles hurry over through the crowd.
We've been waiting out here for hours. Can you get us in?

No, problemo. Ladies, this is my pal Stanley Ipkiss. (leans closer) Stanley's very influential in the banking business. Charlie is truly in his element as he elbows his way thro crowd dragging his entourage with him.
Charlie finally makes through the crush of badies at the way's velvet ropes and calls to one of the two hulking BO that guard the  door.
Hey Bobby! Bobby, buddy. What's happening man? Bobby completely ignores Charlie as he ushers a pasty fac STAR and his underage TARTLET past the ropes.
(to the girls) This will just take a second. (to the other bouncer) Yo Nick! It's me... Charlie! Nick is also completely oblivious.
Forget it, Charlie. I refuse to stand here waiting to be judged by these power-mad steroid jockeys.
How much cash you got on you?
What?
You heard me. How much you got?
I dunno, fifty or sixty bucks.
Hand it over.
No way.

Hey, I'll pay you back! I'm only carrying plastic. C'mon man, you want to stand out here all night? Stanley begrudgingly starts to count out some cash. Charl snatches the whole wad and elbows his way back around to ropes.
(subtly flashing bills) Hey Bobby! Bobby's uncanny tip radar suddenly lights up.

Charlie, how you doin' man? Long time no see. Bobby unsnaps the rope for Charlie and gets the cash hand longs for. The crowd surges around Charlie, Barbie and Pebbles as th by, briefly cutting Stanley off. He catches up just as the all-important rope is SNAPPED c
Hey, wait a minute! Charlie! But Charlie and the girls have already been whisked insid Dorian now steps out of the club and begins to check Bobb list.
I'm with them! Hey, Bobby! But Bobby is back into his deaf and dumb routine. Stanley the rope himself and starts throgh. Bobby and BOUNCER #2
grab Stanley and quickly subdue him.
Hey! Leggo... awk! Dorian glares at Stanley.
Lose him. The bouncers drag Stanley through the crowd and unceremon toss him out into the rain-slick street.

Stanley slowly rises, smoothing out his disheveled clothi horn BLARES and Stanley scrambles to one side as a limo s into the  club's alleyway, splattering him with a wave of muddy wat Stanley wipes the mud from his eyes just in time to see T Carlyle escorted from the back of the limo by a CHAUFFEUR carrying an umbrella.  She's shoe-horned into a heart-stopping red dress that's a losing battle to restrain her decolletage. Their EYES MEET. Tina pauses as she recognizes him.
(SMILES)
Oh... Stanley. Hi. Stanley realizes he looks ridiculous but gives a pathetic wave hello anyway.

Are you okay? Stanley gestures "no problem" and tries to strike a casua against a street lamp, but slips and nearly falls. With a SQUEAL of grinding gears and the KA-POW of a backf car hop pulls Stanley's battered loaner right up behind h Stanley flashes a last nervous smile at Tina, and digs fo car hop's tip money... nothing. He shrugs apologetically to the disgusted car hop and cli The car RATTLES, COUGHS the finally ROARS off in a cloud
exhaust fumes.
A forlorn looking spot on the outskirts of Edge City. We Stanley's car SPUTTERING and POPPING along before it actu pulls into  sight on the dark rain-slick street.
Stanley drives along in a miserable daze. Suddenly the en starts KNOCKING violently and the car dies.

Steam HISSES from the radiator as the car slowly rolls to Stanley GRINDS the ignition key again and again trying fu to restart the  engine. Finally, Stanley fights his way out of the rusted door wi SQUEAL of metal, turns and kicks the bumper... which prom falls off with a  resounding CLUNK. Beat. The front axle collapses, the tires fall off and the driv side door CLATTERS to the ground. Stanley stands there staring at the steaming heap of usel metal... his mind a complete blank. He slowly turns, looking down at the black brackish water swirling along beneath the Tahoochie Bridge. A wave of me sweeps over  him. Stanley plucks a button from his coat and watches as drops down... down to the river below. Suddenly, something catches Stanley's eye... a BODY, floa along in the darkness. He snaps back to reality.
Hey... Hey mister!
Stanley rushes down the slippery embankment beneath the b He spots the body dead ahead, floating along in the moonl

as fast as he can. CAMERA DOLLIES with Stanley as he scrambles down the slop black cat YOWLS as it races past him. He steps on and sha discarded mirror, and he ducks under an old ladder that l against the bridge's foundation as he finally reaches the Stanley splashes into the waist deep water just in time t the body as it floats by.

As Stanley grabs it, the "body" falls to pieces... reveal it's nothing but a trash bag, an old tire and some floati of garbage all  clinging to the "head": an old wooden Mask. Stanley shakes his head in disgust... some lifesaver. Stanley inspects the Mask more closely; strange ritualist symbols carved into a puckish face with a leering grin an empty eye holes. The faintest sound of a haunting "Mask SFX Theme" rises a Stanley turns the Mask around and inspects the inside... bringing it  closer and closer to his face. The surface of the Mask be SHIMMER. But then... RIBET! A frog jumps out of it, right into Sta face. Stanley nearly loses his footing on the slippery ri bottom. Suddenly a blinding SPOTLIGHT shines down from the bridge amplified voice calls out from a squad car.
Hey, you! What are you doing down there? Stanley squints into the light, trying to think of a reas answer.
I was just looking for... (holds up Mask) My mask.
The club is closing up. WAITERS stack chairs on top of ta the B.G. as Tina gathers her sheet music from her PIANIST
Thanks Reno, you're the greatest.
G'night, doll. Tina crosses to the bar area where Dorian lounges with DR FREEZE, SWEET EDDY and CHUN WOO. Dorian toasts her as she up a bar  stool.
That was a great performance, baby. But not as great as the one you pulled off at the bank.
Yeah, well don't get used to it. I'm not going to start running cons for you again, Dorian. I'm a singer now and that's it. Dorian rolls his eyes at Freeze, "Get her".
Oh, really? And you had such a red hot career before you latched on to me? Tina pours herself a drink.
Who latched on to who?
Get real, Tina. You'll do what I say or I'll drop you back where I found you, slingin' hash and dodgin' horny peterbuilt drivers.
(downs a shot) Don't push me, Nicky. I might just take a walk I should have taken a long time ago.
(CHUCKLES)
Easy, baby. Easy. (to his men) I love it when she gets pissed. Dorian scoots over and puts an arm around Tina. She remai
C'mere. You take a hike and who's gonna kiss you like Dorian Tyrel. Tina pours another shot.
C'mon. Who? Tina finally cracks a smile.
Nobody.
(pulls her close) That's right, baby. C'mere. Tina slowly leans in for a kiss, her lips softly parted.. raises a finger to Dorian's lips, stopping him cold. She over at Freeze.
Sorry. I never get personal in front of the help. Tina abruptly stands and exits as Freeze glares at her. Dorian breaks into laughter.
That broad kills me.
She just might, man. The bitch is trouble. Dorian pours them all a drink.
C'mon Doctor, lighten up. (raises his glass) Here's to Edge City Bank. May it crack like an egg on Easter Sunday. Their glasses CLINK.
The police car pulls up in front of Stanley's brownstone wearily climbs out.
Okay, Mr. Ipkiss. Try to be a little more careful next time.
Thanks Officer. The black and white pulls away and Stanley starts across empty street.
Hey, mister... Stanley turns. A razor-cut DEATH'S HEAD PUNKER hops down from a fire esc darkened alleyway.
You a cop or something? A half dozen other DEATH'S HEADS appear out of the shadow decked out in nipple chains, tattoos and other self-mutil
oddments.
Uh... no. They just gave me a lift.
A cop chauffeur? I never seen that before. How about you boys? The other Death's Heads pipe up with "Not Me," "Nope," "P special," etc. as they slowly surround Stanley.

Alright, you guys. It's been a tough night. I haven't got any money. I haven't got a car. All I have is this and you're welcome to it. Stanley tosses Death's Head #1 the Mask. He briefly inspects the funky looking antique, still slic river slime, then tosses it back. He approaches Stanley.
Hey, man. You got us all wrong. We don't want any trouble. I was just going to ask you for the time. That's all. You got the time?
Uh... yeah. As Stanley pulls back his sleeve to check his watch, the Head flicks out a butterfly knife. With a FLASH of steel, slices straight  through Stanley's watch band and snatches the watch.

(holding up his prize) See, I only wanted the time! Heh, he, heh... All the punkers laugh like the half-wits they are as Deat #1 shoves Stanley into Death's Head #2. #2 pushes him bac to #3 and  so on. Stanley is roughly bounced back and forth more and violently within the circle of giggling street toughs. He breaks free and  scrambles to his front door, still reeling with dizziness fumbles with the key and SLAMS the door behind him as the Heads roar with  laughter.
Stanley's wet shoes SQUEAK as he tiptoes past -
A sign that reads "Quiet Please" hangs from the doorknob. continues past it to Apartment "B". Just as he removes hi
Manager's door flies open and MRS. PEENMAN appears. She's dragon in hair curlers who will probably live forever jus spite her  relatives.
Ipkiss! Do you have any idea what time it is? Reflexively, he looks at his (now empty) wrist.
Actually, no.

It's three o'clock in the morning! First, you wake up the entire building laughing it up with your pals. Then, you come in and start squeak - (sees puddles) My new carpet! Just look at that! This is coming out of your cleaning deposit Ipkiss! Stanley, battered, bruised and soaking wet is deep in urb shell-shock.
(SOFTLY)
Are you done?
...Yes.
I think I'll be going to bed now. Mrs. Peenman SLAMS her door.

Small, full of books but very neat. A few cherished anima cels from 1940s cartoons are framed on the wall. As Stanl the door behind  him - he's greeted by MILO, a happy little terrie sized m a big heart.
Hello, Milo. Milo gets so excited he starts GAGGING and COUGHING.
Easy, buddy. I missed you too. Stanley pats Milo on the rump, crosses his tiny kitchenet heads straight into...

Stanley's prized collection of "golden Age" Looney Tunes are neatly displayed on a simple bookshelf. He tosses the Mask down on his bedside table, pops one of cherished Tex Avery cartoons into the V.C.R., plops down bed and  starts to strip off his shoes and socks.
enters, holding a Frisbee in his mouth.
C'mon, Milo. I'm beat. (to the dog YIPS) Okay, okay. One throw. Stanley tosses the Frisbee into the air. The disk sails..

head_text.subj: OUT OF THE BEDROOM AND INTO THE HALLWAY

text: Milo runs it down, leaps up, and makes a perfect catch. H back to the bedroom, and drops it in Stanley's lap.

Easy. This is the best part. On the screen a cartoon dog ZZZIPS into frame and drops a frizzing stick of dynamite down a bad guy's pants. KA-BOO dog LAUGHS  maniacally. Suddenly there is a POUNDING on the wall that rattles Sta framed cartoon cels.

He's dressed in a snazzy zoot suit - a distortion of the material of Stanley's pajamas. The head is no longer Stanley's. It's large, bald and bri green. The huge bug-eyes glow with mischief. O, jeepers--! Stanley/Mask tries to snag the clock, but it bounces away time. Frustrated, he pulls a full sized SLEDGEHAMMER from pocket and  starts POUNDING the floor in an effort to stop the clock. Glancing blows shatter the clock face and most of the wor those bells just keep  ringing. Get him! The Death's Heads pull out nasty homemade weapons and rac the corner into the alleyway.

A Tommy gun! A real one! He immediately sprays the Death's Heads with lead. RATATATATATAT! The greasy punkers dive for cover and scramble out of the under a hail of bullets. Stanley/Mask tosses the gun aside, intoxicated with his n powers.
Wait a minute. This is incredible! Why, with these powers I could be a superhero! I could fight crime... Work for world peace...
But first!...
It's late, but there's still a light on inside.

Burt and Irv, both woozy from drink, attempt to finish a game. A dozen empty beer bottles and two half eaten chili adorn the table. Irv takes a big bite of his chili dog and pauses to regar like a true connoisseur.

I know. Here's the proof... (lets out a long BUUURP) Aaah. Even tastier the second time around. Irv leans forward and sticks out his index finger.
Hey Burt, pull on my finger.

Irv, don't... Irv raises a leg anyway and rips off a nasty fart. BRAAAP

That, my friend is the sweet smell of success.
(SHRUGS)
No style. I give it a five tops.
Okay, how about... Soprano. Irv shifts his weight and hits an amazing high note. PWEE Burt is impressed in spite of himself.
Fine muscle control.

As that light bulb becomes the morning SUN peaking over E City's skyline. CAMERA PULLS BACK through Stanley's bedro window...
Stanley slowly awakens. He grabs his head and moans, look feeling completely hung over. Then suddenly he remembers
out of bed with a start. He looks in the mirror, touching his face. It's the same Stanley. He looks at his paisley PJ's. Same old PJ's. He picks up the mask. Same old mask.
A dream... It was only a dream. Stanley starts to relax. There's a KNOCK at the door.
Stanley's greeted by LT. KELLAWAY (50). This hound-dog of can't help but stare at Stanley's garish pajamas.
Nice PJ's pal.
Can I help you?
You're Ipkiss? Stanley Ipkiss?
That's right.
Some kind of prowler broke in and attacked Mrs. Peenman.
(swallows hard) Really? I didn't hear a thing.

Then you must be a pretty sound sleeper, Ipkiss 'cause she unloaded a couple rounds of 20 ott buckshot five feet from your door. Kellaway swings Stanley's door open wider to give him a b view of the damage. Mrs. Peenman stands there in the hall tearfully speaking to  anither OFFICER. Stanley is flabbergasted to see:
C.U. - The shotgun blasts in the walls. C.U. - The pot holes left from the mallet. C.U. - The shattered remains of the wacky alarm clock. All flashbacks from last night!
(GASPS)
That's... impossible!
Excuse me? Stanley quickly pulls himself together.
That's... a, possible. See, I have this inner ear problem. (wiggles a finger in his ear vigorously) Sometimes I can't hear a thing.
(SKEPTICAL)
Is that a fact?
What? Kellaway leans closer to speak more loudly, but catches h and shoots Stanley a dirty look.
Forget it. He hands Stanley his card.
Here. You remember anything unusual about last night, anything at all, call me.
Sure... thanks. Stanley SLAMS the door and throws his body against it, hi pounding in his chest. Milo gives him that curious  dog-head-cocked-sideways look.
Milo, it was real! How could it all be... real? Stanley suddenly notices the clock on the wall.
Oh my god. I'm late! He races into the bedroom.
Kellaway is taking notes as patiently as he can from Mrs. Peenman.
Look, Mrs. Peenman, you gotta admit your description is pretty tough to swallow.
Then you can choke on it for all I care. I saw what I saw.

Right. (refers to notes) A green head the size of a pumpkin, purple zoot suit and spats. That's a pretty serious fashion risk for any self-respecting second story man. An OFFICER now hurries up the steps all out of breath.
Lt., we just got an emergency call from a mechanic on 67th Street.
What?
Some kind of assault and battery. Sound pretty bad.
(SIGHS)
Alright. Dont' worry Mrs. Peenman, we'll find this guy for you. Officer Deluca here has a few forms you'll have to fill out.
Stanley rushes around the apartment, but he can't find hi anywhere. He finishes tying his tie as he searches.
Milo! Keys! Keys!
Milo's ears prick. He leaps up and immediately starts sni around. He pulls a cushion off the sofa and emerges with just as Stanley  comes out, briefcaase in hand.

Good boy. He pets his dog, takes his keys and starts out the door.. pauses to take a last look at the mask... It's eerie blac holes and devilish  grin seem to mock him. On sudden impulse, he grabs it, hurls it out the balcony' sliding glass door and exits.
Sailing end over end through the air.
As the mask flies out into the sir, a sudden wind kicks u The mask arcs back toward the building like a boomerang a balanced precariously on a narrow ledge. Its mocking grin to glow  with triumph.

The place looks like it's been hit by cartoon graffiti  guerrillas: Everything's printed in polka-dots, checks, t etc. The  "Ripley Auto Finishing" sign hangs askew over the doorway Letters have been sprayed out to read "Rip Off!" They're both in severe discomfort and look more like cars men: Bodies spray painted metallic colors, hood ornaments to their  foreheads, wire rims under each limb, and gleaming four f mufflers sticking out of their rear ends. They wince in pain at each tiny bump of the gurney.
Ah!... Eeeh!... Ooh! Paramedic #3 speaks into his emergency radio-phone as Bur Irv are loaded into the van.

How did you...
Whoever this guy is, he's a world class twisto. PEGGY BRANDT, an attractive young woman in her mid twenti appears besides the other reporters and approaches Kellaw notepad in  hand.
Excuse me, Lt., I'm with the Evening Star. Can you tell me what happened here?
Sorry. Too early to comment.
It looks like some kind of mob scare tactic.

I said no comment. Now break it up. This is a crime scene. As the officers disperse the reporters and other onlooker slips away from the group. Even though it's closed off wi yellow police  tape, Peggy slips inside the garage.
The empty garage has been turned into a topsy-turvy night The same cartoon paint job covers the walls. Peggy looks

through some papers scattered all over the floor. Nothing Then she spies the COMPLAINT BOX. Peggy opens it and pull HANDFUL of pink "comment" slips. She looks at them. Almos them are from one customer - STANLEY IPKISS.
Stanley, still looking rumpled and unshaven, hurriedly ta his coat and powers up his computer. Charlie steps over t desk carrying a  newspaper.
What happened to you last night? The girls and I were looking all over for you.
I uh, didn't feel so good. I decided to go home early.
As a matter of fact, you don't look so good. You got to take better care of yourself, man.
How was the club?
Are you kidding? It was hotter than a pistol. Did you see the paper?
No.
Your girlfriend got a great review. Chralie flips open the Entertainment section of the Eveni There's a great close-up of Tina singing her heart out wi
"Bombshell Explodes at Monnkey's Paw." MR. DICKEY, the smarmy office manager who is younger than Stanley, now appears.
Ipkiss! You're forty minutes late! Every time you do that you're robbing this bank of its time and money!
Sorry, Mr. Dicky. It won't happen again.
(snatches newspaper) If you weren't so busy ogling girlie pictures you'd get some work done around here.
Ah... She's a prospective client of Stanley's, sir.
(sudden attitude change) She is? Well... Next time she comes in see that you send her directly to my office.
Yes sir, Mr. Dickey. Dickey tosses the paper back on Stanley's desk and marche through the bank.
Look at that little creep. If it wasn't for his daddy he'd be out somewhere shakin' down school kids for lunch money. Stanley toys with the Kleenex that bears Tina's lipstick
You think she ever will come back, Charlie?
Who knows? Forget about her, Stanley. A dame like that is always looking for the B.B.D. The bigger better deal. Ask her what her sign is and she'll say dollar.
You don't know that. She's an artist. Maybe she's sensitive.
Yeah. She can sense a guy's credit line at two hundred yards. Stanley, you need a girl you can depend on. Someone a little more down to earth... someone like...
as Peggy Brandt stops by a teller's window, looking sharp pretty in a blazer and jeans.
Excuse me, can you tell me where I can find Stanley Ipkiss?
Like her! Someone like her. (straightens tie) As a matter of fact I could use someone like her myself. (rises as Peggy approaches) Hel-lo there. May I be of some assistance?
Stanley Ipkiss? Charlie begrudgingly points to Stanley.
Hi. I'm Peggy Brandt. I'm with the Evening Star.
Oh, hi. I already have a subscription, thanks.
Oh no, actually I just wanted to ask you a few questions.
Really? About what?
Ripley Auto Finishing. You're a customer of theirs aren't you?
I... uh. No. I think you must have made a mistake. Peggy produces one of the complaint slips.
Isn't this a form of theirs you filled out?
(nervous chuckle) Oh, that Ripley Auto. I guess I have stopped in there once or twice, Miss... what did you say your name was?
Peggy Brandt.
Wait a minute... Peggy Brandt of "Ask Peggy"?
That's right.
(brightens up) You printed my letter last year, remember? "Nice Guys Finish Last."
You're Mr. Nice Guy? Stanley do you realize how much mail we got about that letter? There's hundreds of women out there who are looking for a man just like you.
Are you serious?
Of course. DO you know how hard it is to find a decent man in this town? Most of them think monogamy is some kind of wood.
Why are you covering this story?

They cut my salary. I just can't make it by on "Dear Peggy" anymore. The truth is, I want to be a real reporter and if I can break this story I know they'll let me. (sits closer) Look Stanley, I know Ripley Auto is a crooked operation. They may even have had ties to the Mob. I'm not out to get you. I just want the truth.
I wish I knew the truth, Peggy. I really do.

Pull a few strings. Find something in the fine print. I don't care how you do it, but do it. You owe me.
(CHUCKLES)

I owe you nothing, you little piece of shit. I got your liquor license when nobody else would touch... Dorian suddenly EXPLODES, overturning his desk and sendin tumbling backwards. In less than a heartbeat, he grabs Sn his shirt  ffront, SLAMS him up against the wall, SMASHES a whiskey and presses the jagged edge to his throat. Snell hangs there whimpering. Dorian has a crazed look in eyes as he gazes at the Councilman's lapel.
(SOFTLY)
That's pretty. What is that, a carnation? Snell nods. Dorian takes a deep whiff.
Nice. Hey, Eddy... call my florist. Two dozen pink carnations to Mrs. Snell with my regrets over her husband's untimely accident. Tears begin to well up in Snell's eyes.
(GASPING)
No... please. I can do it. I can make it happen. Dorian eases back... brushes off Snell's coat.
That's smart. You're a very smart man. Now pull yourself together. Look at you. Dorian picks up an Uzi from Dr. Freeze's equipment.
Shut the Swede down, Snell. We'll buy him out cheap with a little collateral the bank is about to provide us. (looks at his men) And Gentlemen... we are going to be in the casino business.
Distant sirens can be heard over the occasional sound of gunshot. It's a reasonably peaceful night in Edge City.

Oh, Stanley! She runs to his arms and they embrace in a passionate kis Tina suddenly pulls back and begins rapidly licking Stanl ear... which is  kinda weird.

Milo, down. He pushes Milo away, tosses back the covers and rises out It's still the dead of night and Stanley is all in a huff his dream. He spots Tina's clipping on his dresser mirror and rips i upset with himself.

Through his bedroom window, propped up on the fourth stor Its leering grin seems to beckon Stanley as we begin to h POUNDING beat of the Mask F.X. theme.
stands transfixed, staring at the moonlit face. He can al hear echos of faint whispered VOICES calling his name. A siren song above  the pounding drums.

No... He backs away from the window.
shimmers as the WHISPERS grow louder.
takes a last look at the crumpled picture of Tina in his finally loses control. He bolts from the room.
Stanley is a driven man as he makes his way out onto the ledge. Milo tugs at his pajama leg, but Stanley kicks him and climbs out  over the ledge.

watches from the apratment window, whimpering softly.

carefully reaches down, his fingers just brushing the mas teeters out over nothingness. Night traffic whizzes by do below.
